The current behavior is that fused=None and fused=True have the same behavior (try to use fused=True but revert to fused=False if the conditions are not met). I'm not entirely sure why this but might possibly be due to backwards compatibility? Not certain.

tf.layers.batch_normalization should be cleaned-up in the future since there are quite a few optional parameters right now, many of which are not compatible. But that's a separate issue, this doc change is technically correct but I can't confirm if it's intended or not.

The current behavior is that fused=None and fused=True have the same behavior (try to use fused=True but revert to fused=False if the conditions are not met). I'm not entirely sure why this but might possibly be due to backwards compatibility? Not certain.

tf.layers.batch_normalization should be cleaned-up in the future since there are quite a few optional parameters right now, many of which are not compatible. But that's a separate issue, this doc change is technically correct but I can't confirm if it's intended or not.
